question.text: Two particles A and B move with constant velocities <math><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>. At the initial moment their position vectors are <math><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> respectively. The condition for particles A and B for their collision is:

options.text: <math><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mfenced close="|" open="|" separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mfenced close="|" open="|" separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>

solution.text:
For two particles to collide, the direction of the relative velocity of one with respect to other should be directed towards the relative position of the other particle
i.e. \(\frac{\vec{r}_1-\vec{r}_2}{\left|\vec{r}_1-\vec{r}_2\right|} \rightarrow\) direction of relative position of 1 w.r.t. 2.
& \(\frac{\vec{v}_2-\vec{v}_1}{\left|\vec{v}_2-\vec{v}_1\right|} \rightarrow\) direction of velocity of 2 w.r.t. 1
So for collision of A & B
\(\frac{\vec{r}_1-\vec{r}_2}{\left|\vec{r}_1-\vec{r}_2\right|}=\frac{\vec{v}_2-\vec{v}_1}{\left|\vec{v}_2-\vec{v}_1\right|}\)
